te:
> Consider the following example:  I have to display a sorted list in a=
 web
> page, and I only have a functional test that verifies that the HTML =
is
> correct.  My coverage confirms that my ordering logic is run during th=
e
> tests.  In this situation, the ordering logic is private and not direct=
ly
> tested.
> 
> A user reports that the list is not sorted correctly, and=
 now I find myself
> with at least two possible locations to investigate:  =
the HTML generation
> and the sorting logic.
> 
> If I had written a test f=
or the private sorting logic, I would know right
> away where the bug is.

=
Hi Cedric,

Very well put.  I believe this would be a great canonical examp=
le of why peeking into 
private methods is not only OK, but the preferred w=
ay to test, in some cases.
